titleStmt.title: William W. Brownfield et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9704

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the honourable B Magoffin Governor of Kentucky The undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent unto your honour that at the September Term of the Taylor Circuit Court a fine of $200. was assessed against James Jones on a presentment for gaming, The undersigned would most respectfully represent unto your honour that said Jones is quite a poor man with a family & that it will take all his property to pay said fine, we would further represent, that he took the Case to the Court of Appeals but for want of the clrk in the court below getting the record ready in time the Case was dismissed in the Court of Appeals. A copy of the Instructions in the court below, the bill of Exception the affidavits for a new trial, &c in the Case, are all made a part of this petition & in view of the whole premises we most respectfully petition your honour to remit said fine, as it will seriously injure said Jones & his family as it will take their entire means to pay the fine

Wm W. Brownfield
John Risler
William Rodgers
T. T. Shipp
Robert Friend
G W Dobson
Thos. J. Brownfield
Jas A Atherton
Richard H Atherton
Harrissen Atherton
